raw_outputs.complexity_llm:
time_complexity: O(n),
space_complexity: O(1),
explanation: The time complexity, or running time, of this algorithm scales linearly with the size of its input 'n' because it contains a single loop that iterates from 1 to n. This means if we double the number, the computation will take roughly twice as long assuming each operation within the loop takes constant time. Space complexity is O(1) since no additional space (storage memory aside for storing inputs or outputs) grows with input size 'n'. Only a fixed amount of variables are used regardless of 'n', which in this case includes only two: `num` and `result`.
